pullRequest.title: package manager API definition
pullRequest.bodyText:
Issue #, if available:
Description of changes:
This is to define package manager API for DA to integrate.
By submitting this pull request, I confirm that you can use, modify, copy, and redistribute this contribution, under the terms of your choice.

nodes.bodyText: The D in MetaData should be lowercase.
Why do we need this? SemVer already gives us a way to parse version ranges.
Don't bring in extra dependencies like this, we already have this utility: https://github.com/aws/aws-greengrass-kernel/blob/master/src/main/java/com/aws/iot/evergreen/util/Utils.java#L73.
No runtime exceptions.
I agree with Michael here. It's not worth adding 498KB to the binary for one method. Also package management and DA don't not necessarily need to be separate repos
What's the reason of including dependencies in PackageMetadata?
Why is this needed? What's the intend usage of this field?
It seems this four annotations can be replaced by @value annotation.
Is the proposedPackage the top level packages or all the packages? If it's the latter, then it seems it's redundant because PackageMetadata already contains dependencies.
What's the intended use case of this method?

This should be Json serializable. Add corresponding annotations for JsonProperties and JsonInclude
Here is what I think the name will be in the Json coming from cloud - https://quip-amazon.com/WQHjAZhdhngl/E2E-Demo#KBI9CA3DCl9. I would keep the names of the member variables in the class corresponding to that.
Is this Json Serializable from string? If not then getter method needs to be defined
Is this true?. It is possible that either of these two are not sent in the deployment configuration.
Should we name this resolved version? As this is coming as resolved version from the cloud?
I think this should be included in the Equals method. Two dependencies of same package with different version constraints can exist.
proposedPackage -> proposedPackages
Need to add another member called parameters, for accepting parameters for the package
Will this contain the real implementations, or is this expected to be an interface or maybe an abstract class?
If we don't need these imports, let's remove them.
@wikimonkey Please make sure it works with Jackson since that is what we're using. We don't write the deserialization logic, Jackson takes care of it for us.
What is the version constraint? Isn't the constraint already included in the semver?
Rename this to match PackageMetadataTest since you renamed PackageMetadata.

this should be metadata here as well, with no underscore.
Additionally, the Given should be all caps like the other keywords: GIVEN_package_metadata_WHEN....
Why use Reference? It looks like it should just point to a Package, PackageMetadata, or PackageRegistryEntry. What am I missing?
Needs rebase, this was already added
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -91,6 +91,11 @@
             <artifactId>netty-all</artifactId>
             <version>4.1.44.Final</version>
         </dependency>
+        <dependency>

nodes.bodyText: We probably shouldn't be using experimental features

commit.message: switch to use internal utils; reformat
make findbug happy by uncomment private method now
